remarks: The supremum metric on ` RR ^ I ` is equivalent to the ` Rn ` metric. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 15-Sep-2015.)
statement:
rrnequiv.y $e |- Y = ( ( CCfld |`s RR ) ^s I ) $.
rrnequiv.d $e |- D = ( dist ` Y ) $.
rrnequiv.1 $e |- X = ( RR ^m I ) $.
rrnequiv.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. Fin ) $.
rrnequiv $p |- ( ( ph /\ ( F e. X /\ G e. X ) ) -> ( ( F D G ) <_ ( F ( Rn ` I ) G ) /\ ( F ( Rn ` I ) G ) <_ ( ( sqrt ` ( # ` I ) ) x. ( F D G ) ) ) ) $.
